oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Farmers inspecting clover pasture
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Holman, H.E., photographer
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Cannon farmers on joint County agent Soil Conservation District tour, look over four acres of ladino clover that has carried seven cows and some hogs most of the time. This pasture was established on class two land in August 1948 using one and a half pounds ladino, four hundred pounds 4-8-12 and two tons of lime per acre.

One in a series of photographs of agricultural activities in Cannon County, TN that were taken by W.L. Clement, District Conservationist for the U.S. Soil Conservation Service, and his assistants between the mid-1940s and mid-1970s.
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Photographs of W.L. Clement, U.S. Soil Conservation Service
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Soil Conservation Districts
Photographic prints;
Ladino clover;
